conversation.text: Hi, how can I help you today?
I would like to learn how to cook a dessert for a dinner party I am hosting tonight. What would you recommend?
I can teach you how to make coconut oil cakes. How does that sound?
evidence: coconut oil pound cake

conversation.text: Great! What ingredients do I need?

You will need 1 cup of coconut oil, 2 cups sugar, 1.5 cups of milk, 6 large eggs, 1 tsp vanilla, lime zest from 2 limes, 0.5 cups of flour, 3.5 tsp of baking powder, 0.225 tsp of grated nutmeg, and 0.5 tsp of salt.
evidence: coconut oil, pour 1 cup (200 g)
2 cups (450 g) of sugar
1½ cups (350 ml) of milk, 6 large eggs, 1 teaspoon of vanilla, and the zest from 2 limes
½ cups (440 g) of flour, 3½ teaspoons of baking powder, ¼ teaspoon of grated nutmeg, and ½ teaspoon of salt.

conversation.text: Got it. What do I do next?
You will need you need to preheat your oven and get a 10-cup volume Bundt pan ready. Do you have baking spray?
evidence: Turn on the oven and prepare your pan.

conversation.text: OK, what should I preheat the oven to? I have a pan, but no baking spray.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. You can grease the pan with butter or coconut oil instead. Make sure to cover it well. Then, sprinkle a quarter cup of flour into the pan and shake it around so that the inside is evenly coated.
evidence: Ensure that you completely spray the inside of the pan, especially if your pan has an intricate design. Set your prepared pan aside while you make the cake batter. If you don't have baking spray, rub the inside of the pan with butter or coconut oil. Sprinkle about 1/4 of a cup of flour into the pan and shake it so that the inside is completely greased and floured.

conversation.text: Ok, thanks! What next?
You will need to mix your wet ingredients. Is your coconut oil liquid or is it solid?
My coconut oil is liquid. I've just measured out a cup of it.
Ok, grab a large mixing bowl and pour in the coconut oil. Then, add the sugar, milk, eggs, vanilla, and lime zest. Mix everything together until completely combined.
evidence: pour 1 cup (200 g) of it into a large mixing bowl. Add 2 cups (450 g) of sugar, 1½ cups (350 ml) of milk, 6 large eggs, 1 teaspoon of vanilla, and the zest from 2 limes into the mixing bowl and whisk until the wet ingredients are completely combined. Set this mixture aside.

conversation.text: All done! Should I do anything else with the mixture?
No, you can set the mixture aside now. It's time to combine the dry ingredients together. Do you have another whisk ready?
evidence: Set this mixture aside.
Stir together the dry ingredients

conversation.text: No, I used my only whisk for the wet ingredients. What should I do?

You can shift your ingredients into a separate mixing bowl and stir them instead. You will want to mix together 3 and a half cups of flour, 3 and a half teaspoons baking powder, a quarter teaspoon of grated nutmeg, and half a teaspoon of salt.
evidence: sifting the dry ingredients into your bowl and stirring them.

conversation.text: Ok, I sifted everything together!
Ok! Are you sure everything's combined well? The dry ingredients will need to be mixed well so that they absorb the wet ingredients evenly.
evidence: Whisking the dry ingredients ensures that they absorb the wet ingredients evenly

conversation.text: Yes, I've got it.

Next, you will combine the wet and dry ingredients together. Add half of your dry mixture into your bowl with the wet ingredients by sprinkling it into the bowl. Then, you can use a spatula to fold the ingredients together.
evidence: Sprinkle half of the dry mixture over the wet mixture. Take a spatula and fold the dry ingredients into the wet.

conversation.text: How do I fold the dry ingredients into the wet? I'm not sure what that means.

You will make circular motions with your wrist in order to combine the mixtures. After they are combined, you will want to add the other half of your dry mixture and finish folding everything together.
evidence: Use your wrist to make a circular motion as you mix the ingredients.

conversation.text: Ok, how will I know when I can stop mixing?
You will fold the mixtures together only until they are just combined, You don't want to mix the batter too much, otherwise the cake will be too dense and tough.
evidence: Avoid stirring the batter too much or your cake will be tough and lose volume.

conversation.text: Alright, I think everything is combined now.
Great! Now it's time to bake the cake. Pour your batter into your Bundt pan and smooth the top with your spatula. Then, you will bake the cake in the oven for around an hour.
evidence: Pour the batter into the prepared Bundt pan and use a spatula to smooth the top. Place the cake into the preheated oven and bake for about 1 hour.

conversation.text: The cake has been baking for a little over an hour now. What's next?
It's time to test if your cake is finished. Does it look golden brown
evidence: The cake will be golden brown and a tester will come out clean when the cake is finished. Since Bundt pans come in a variety of styles, your cake may take more or less time. If you need to add more time, set your timer for 5 minute increments. Keep checking until your cake is baked.

conversation.text: No, the cake is still a bit pale. I tried sticking a tester into it but it didn't come out clean. What should I do?
Let it bake for another 5 minutes and check your cake again.
evidence: set your timer for 5 minute increments. Keep checking until your cake is baked.

conversation.text: Alright, I left it in the oven for another 5 minutes and it's all done now!
Perfect! Remove your cake from the oven and let it rest in the Bundt pan for 15 minutes. After that, flip it onto a cooling rack and let the cake cool down fully.
evidence: Remove the cake from the oven and leave it in the Bundt pan for 15 minutes. You can then flip it out onto a cooling rack to let it finish cooling completely.

conversation.text: Got it! Am I all finished now?
Depends! Do you want to glaze your cake?
evidence: You can serve the cake immediately or glaze it with a topping of your choice.

conversation.text: No, I prefer my cakes plain.
Sounds good! Your cake is not ready to serve. Bon appetit!
Thank you so much for your help!
Glad I could help you! Goodbye.
Bye now, chat again soon.

recipe.title: How to Make Coconut Oil Cakes

procedure.summary: Turn on the oven and prepare your pan.
procedure.description: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 C). Spray a 10-cup capacity Bundt pan with baking spray. Ensure that you completely spray the inside of the pan, especially if your pan has an intricate design. Set your prepared pan aside while you make the cake batter. If you don't have baking spray, rub the inside of the pan with butter or coconut oil. Sprinkle about 1/4 of a cup of flour into the pan and shake it so that the inside is completely greased and floured.

If you have liquid coconut oil, pour 1 cup (200 g) of it into a large mixing bowl. Add 2 cups (450 g) of sugar, 1½ cups (350 ml) of milk, 6 large eggs, 1 teaspoon of vanilla, and the zest from 2 limes into the mixing bowl and whisk until the wet ingredients are completely combined. Set this mixture aside. If your coconut oil is hard, measure it out and melt it in a small saucepan on the stove over low heat. You could also microwave it to liquefy it.

In a separate mixing bowl, place 3½ cups (440 g) of flour, 3½ teaspoons of baking powder, ¼ teaspoon of grated nutmeg, and ½ teaspoon of salt. Whisk the dry ingredients together for about 30 seconds. Set the dry mixture aside. Whisking the dry ingredients ensures that they absorb the wet ingredients evenly. If you don't have a whisk, try sifting the dry ingredients into your bowl and stirring them.

procedure.summary: Combine the wet and dry ingredients.
procedure.description: Sprinkle half of the dry mixture over the wet mixture. Take a spatula and fold the dry ingredients into the wet. Use your wrist to make a circular motion as you mix the ingredients. Add the rest of the dry mixture and finish folding the ingredients just until they're combined. Avoid stirring the batter too much or your cake will be tough and lose volume.

procedure.summary: Bake the coconut oil pound cake.
procedure.description: Pour the batter into the prepared Bundt pan and use a spatula to smooth the top. Place the cake into the preheated oven and bake for about 1 hour. The cake will be golden brown and a tester will come out clean when the cake is finished. Since Bundt pans come in a variety of styles, your cake may take more or less time. If you need to add more time, set your timer for 5 minute increments. Keep checking until your cake is baked.

Remove the cake from the oven and leave it in the Bundt pan for 15 minutes. You can then flip it out onto a cooling rack to let it finish cooling completely. You can serve the cake immediately or glaze it with a topping of your choice. For an optional coconut glaze, toast 1/2 cup of flaked coconut and add 1/2 cup of sugar, 1 cup of water, and a pinch of salt. Bring the mixture to a boil and stir until the sugar dissolves. Spread this coconut glaze on the cooled cake and let it set before you slice it.
